content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    str = strip(str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, " " => "_")
    str = replace(str, "-" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

This function takes a string `col` representing the column name as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace using the built-in `strip()` function. Finally, it replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores using `replace()` function.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my-column")
"my_column"
```

This function will be useful when you want to standardize the formatting of column names in a consistent manner.
